1. A clear container (e.g., a fish tank)

4. Black felt
5. A bright light source

Line the bottom of the container with dry ice, then place the black felt on top, soaked in alcohol. Seal the container, and shine the light through the side. As particles pass through, they'll leave visible trails in the supersaturated alcohol vapor.

Safety precautions include wearing gloves when handling dry ice and ensuring proper ventilation. This experiment is engaging and educational without any startling elements. Would you like more information on the physics behind the cloud chamber?
